DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Recurrent Refractory Progressive Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that address recurrent, refractory, progressive disease assessments as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Recurrent Disease Refractory Disease Progressive Disease Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The return of a disease after a period of remission._A disease that resists treatment._A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Refractory Disease Progressive Disease Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.:A disease that resists treatment.:A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Stage IB-IVB MF/SS (maximal stage since diagnosis), and has relapsed, are refractory, or progressed after at least one standard systemic therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have disease tha
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have disease that has relapsed and/or refractory after their most recent therapy, with progressive disease (PD) being defined as an increase of 25% from the lowest response value in any one or more of the following: Serum M-component protein (the absolute increase must be greater than or equal to 0.5 g/dL) and/or Urine M-component protein (the absolute increase must be greater than or equal to 200 mg/24 hours) and/or Only in subjects without a measurable serum and urine M protein level: the difference between involved and uninvolved free light chain (FLC) levels (absolute increase) must be greater than 10 mg/dL; and/or Definite development of new bone lesions or soft tissue plasmacytomas or definite increase in the size of existing bone lesions or soft tissue plasmacytomas and/or Development of hypercalcemia (corrected serum calcium greater than 11.5 mg/dL) that can be attributed solely to the plasma cell proliferative disorder?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is registered to Dose Expansion Part 2 and has melanoma or renal cell cancer, did patient receive prior immunotherapy with an anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 containing regimen and must has progressive or recurrent disease after prior PD-1/PD-L1 directed therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have new, progressive or recurrent disease in first-line patients defined as cisplatin-ineligible based on renal impairment (creatinine clearance calculated by Cockcroft-Gault method less than 60ml/min), at least grade 2 hearing loss and/or ECOG status of 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in the proteasome-relapsed/refractory expansion cohort, does patient have multiple myeloma which has relapsed after prior PI exposure or is PI-refractory, defined as nonresponsive to treatment or progression within 60 days of last exposure to a PI?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have IPSS intermediate-2 or high risk MDS that is refractory to treatment with HMA therapy at the time of enrollment defined as: failure to respond to HMA therapy (no complete response by at least 6 cycles or any progression of disease prior), recurrence or progression of MDS following initial response to HMA therapy, intolerance to HMAs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is registered in the dose expansion, does patient have either: colorectal cancer that has previously progressed on irinotecan and tolerated an irinotecan dose equal to or greater than the recommended phase 2 dose (RP2D) OR gastroesophageal cancer that has progressed on at least one first-line therapy for metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Relapsed/Refractory High-Risk Neuroblastoma (NBL) (defined as disease recurrence after completion of therapy, progressive disease on therapy, or refractory disease during induction therapy) or Relapsed Osteosarcoma (relapsed after frontline therapy and/or there must not be any potentially curative treatment options available at the time of enrollment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have progressive or recurrent disease in first-line patients defined as platinum ineligible based on renal impairment (creatinine clearance calculated by Cockcroft-Gault method less than 60ml/min), grade 2 hearing loss and/or ECOG status of 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has osteosarcoma, does patient have progressive, recurrent or refractory disease after all curative measures, including first line chemotherapy?
